snippet: An intense debate of immigration policy embroils Pomona College after 17 illegal immigrants working in the dining halls are fired.
abstract: An intense debate of immigration policy embroils Pomona College after 17 illegal immigrants working in the dining halls are fired.
lead_paragraph: Pomona College, one of the lauded Claremont Colleges in California, has come under fire for dismissing 17 dining hall employees because they could not produce proof of legal residency. Students and school officials alike are questioning whether dismissing the workers betrays the school's liberal ideals.

headline.main: Worker Firings at a California College Spur Immigration Debate
